refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: armax is used to identify the coefficients of a n-dimensional ARX process
where e(t) is a n-dimensional white noise with variance I. sig an nxn matrix and A(z) and B(z):

for the method see Eykhoff in trends and progress in system identification, page 96. with z(t)=[y(t-1),..,y(t-r),u(t),...,u(t-s)] and coef= [-a1,..,-ar,b0,...,b_s] we can write y(t)= coef* z(t) + sig*e(t) and the algorithm minimises sum_{t=1}^N ( [y(t)- coef'z(t)]^2) where t0=max(max(r,s)+1,1))).

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: //-Ex1- Arma model : y(t) = 0.2*u(t-1)+0.01*e(t-1) ny=1,nu=1,sig=0.01; Arma=armac(1,[0,0.2],[0,1],ny,nu,sig) //defining the above arma model u=rand(1,1000,'normal'); //a random input sequence u y=arsimul(Arma,u); //simulation of a y output sequence associated with u. Armaest=armax(0,1,y,u); //Identified model given u and y. Acoeff=Armaest('a'); //Coefficients of the polynomial A(x) Bcoeff=Armaest('b') //Coefficients of the polynomial B(x) Dcoeff=Armaest('d'); //Coefficients of the polynomial D(x) [Ax,Bx,Dx]=arma2p(Armaest) //Results in polynomial form.
